conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C, and the task is to predict whether it flows into container D or E after passing through baffles.
Points A, B, and C are at the top of the image, with A being pink, B being white, and C being green.
There are colored blocks and bars in the image, including red, green, blue, brown, and others, which direct the flow of liquid.
Containers D and E are located at the bottom of the image, with D being red and E being green.
The pink liquid flows directly downward from point A.
The pink liquid encounters the red block and is directed towards the blue and brown blocks.
The pink liquid flows left and right past the blue block.
The white liquid flows downward from point B and hits the green bar, directing it left.
The white liquid merges slightly with the pink liquid and flows towards the blue and brown blocks.
The green liquid flows downward from point C along the green bar.
The green liquid separates, with some moving towards the blue block and other parts flowing right.
The pink and white liquids flow around the blue block.
The pink liquid flows left towards container E.
The white and green liquids continue towards container D.
The pink liquid accumulates in container E.
The white and green liquids accumulate in container D.
After passing through the baffles, the pink liquid flows into container E, while the white and green liquids flow into container D.
